Posts.Content: Hello.When I had chemo 2 years ago I was advised not to travel because of the risk of infection because at the airport there are people travelling from all over the world and even on the plane you don't know, some people can be ill or can have infection and your immunity will be very low. I even stopped working during the chemo I was on sick pay till I haven't finished the chemo. I started travelling after all treatment finished.I didn't want to end up in a hospital with infection. Denisa
Posts.Title: chemo & travel

Posts.Content: Hi Lou,something similar happened to me.I have finished all my treatment in December but 3 weeks ago I had to go to the A&E because my temperature went up to 39.4.My Gp refused me to give me emergency appointment so i had to go to hospital.They found i had this horrible flu,they give me some IV paracetamol which helped me and I was discharged after few hours with Tamiflu tablets to take for 5 days which worked as a miracle.I dont have high temperature or cough but my nose is still running from time to time.My oncologist told me that it will take some time to my immunity go back to normal.I am only 40 but was really scary that high fever. I hope you will get better soon.
Posts.Title: My rush to A&E...

Posts.Content: Hello.I have just finished 7 cycles of chemo.Had 4xEC and 3xTaxol.I was also grade 3.After chemo finished my initially 4.1 cm lump nearly dissapeared. I am having a lumpectomy on 22.8.and I cant wait to take it out.Yes chemo was long but if you look after yourself you will be fine.I didnt have almost no side effects except my hair but my hair already started to grow back.My oncologist said its much better to have chemo before surgery so they can see if its working they always can change the meds and if its shrinks they just do lumpectomy.I know its hard but try to stay positive.
Posts.Title: Neoadjuvent Chemo

Posts.Content: Hi.Its worth to try it.I was using it. Had 4xEC and 3xT and my hair started just fall out after the 4th cycle because I didnt want to use it anymore too much hassle around waiting for the cap because they just have couple of them and the time consuming. Maybe if i would use till end i wouldnt loose it.Anyway my hair started to grow back within month the treatment finished.Now more then 1 year finishing I have thicker hair and have ponytail. First few min.are not very comfortable but with paracetamol is ok.I took my own towel because when they disconnect it all the ice will melt and you can be wet around your neck so i just had the towel like a scarf. Denisa
Posts.Title: Cold Cap - is it worth trying with AC Chemo?

Posts.Content: Hello:)I had lumpectomy and radio last year and i am working as a senior care assistant so it involved loads of physical moving and handling.I was off sick for 8 weeks.Thats what my surgeon told me to avoid any heavy lifting for 8 weeks and i reduced my full time hours only for 15 hrs per week and only for weekends because i was having radio from Mon-Fr.I know the sick pay was rubbish but I didn't want to risk anything.I went back full time in January thia year but now i will reduce my hrs again because I just found out not long time ago that i am pregnant. Take so much time off how much you need. Wish all the best Denisa
Posts.Title: how long off work after lumpectomy and sentinel node biopsy

Posts.Content: Hello,wow you are an active lady.Thats good.When I had chemo i was just doing loads of walking I was trying to walk at least every day 10 000 steps.But because I had PICC line inserted they told me not to do any running or jogging or lifting with that arm because the picc line could come out or the dressing got wet from sweat. About the swimming they told me to avoid crowded places, because your immunity will be low and swimming pools are sometimes full of germs and bacteria. After 1 year treatment finished I am still a germ freak:)I just doing 3-4 km running when I am not working and if its raining I am just doing some exercising at home. I wish you all the best with the chemo take care Denisa
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hello I agree with you regarding  adverts.I have to switch the channel to not bring  memories back.I am 1 year after treatment and trying to forget but this adverts are like constant reminder and they actually saying "Oh poor those who has cancer they are going to die anyway." And shaving heads just for fun its different when you actually loose your hair because of chemotherapy.
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Hello:)very well said or written. agree.If they wanted to find cure they would.But if they find a cure for all of us they would loose money for all these chemo and hormone therapy drugs isnt it?And all these trials too.I was offered an Aspirin trial, apparently stops breast cancer coming back.First I was thinking to join then I was wondering if I want to damage my stomach for 5 years and there is not even proof its working.Its all about business for pharmaceuticals. I agree these adverts upsetting me too.Especially there was one, with an older lady trying on a blue wig and laughing.When I lost my hair last year I wasnt laughing about it.Even when I switch channels there are pictures everywhere around London, I hate them especially on the bus stops.
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Hi  last year i had chemo,lumpectomy and radio.I had my first mammogram 1 year from my diagnosis which was this year in February/March.And my radio finished in December last year so it wasnt 6 month.My surgeon said it was 1 year from diagnosis.And now I have my 2nd one coming this January. Denisa
Posts.Title: November 2018 Radiotherapy Thread

Posts.Content: Hello.I had 7 cycles of chemo and after 3rd one and the 6th one I had an ultrasound to check if it was shrinking and it did.But maybe it depends on the hospital.But you can always ask them. Good luck with your treatment.
Posts.Title: Neo adjuvant chemotherapy, midway scan

Posts.Content: Hello,I am working as a health care assistant.When I was diagnosed last year Jan.and I was told the treatment plan I went to my employer and I have explained the situation.Then I went to the GP and got a sick not for time beeing on chemo.The statutory sick pay is not even 400 pound per month but at least I have avoided any infections.I had also picc line inserted so couldt do much with my left arm anyway.The time I have finished chemo my sick pay finished and I spoke to my boss and have changed my full time hours to 15 hrs per week.I went back to work between chemo and surgery and went off sick for 8 weeks after surgery and working again during radiotherapy. The biggest issue was when my statutory sick pay finished.financially was a struggle.Anyway the employer should do arrangments for you and cant discriminate you.Now I am back working full time hours.You shouldnt use your holyday for appointments,can ask for day off or something.I dont know really the law but you can contact the Citizens Bureau Advice and ask them. Take care and good luck with the treatment Denisa
Posts.Title: work!

Posts.Content: Hello.Before radiotherapy I was thinking to buy them online they have a website where you can purchase them but I found it too expensive.When I was on radio I was using only E45 and had no issues with skin at all.Everytime I got home from radio I covered my chest in E45 and then after bath. Denisa
Posts.Title: Everything and the Big C

Posts.Content: Hello,oh that sounds awful.I was bullied by my colleague and my boss quiet liked her so he didnt do anything about her.It was 2 months ago I even quit my job.He knew I had cancer treatment last year and I was working hard between surgery and radio,I was signed off sick for chemo.I got only statutory sick pay for 7 months which was miserable  35O per month or so but I didnt want to risk any infection and I was ok. My colleagues talked to me not to quit and fight so i have retracted my resignation and complained to the Head office about her and him doing nothing about it. She was sacked and he got I think warning because he is reallt polite to me now. So might be an idea to complain about him.And regarding financial issues I went to Citizen bureau advice to ask or you can call even McMillans helpline. I hope you will get it sorted soon You need to take care about yourself. Sending hugs Denisa
Posts.Title: Potentially stupid question - Chemotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi just want to give you bit of support.I had finished treatment almost 2 years ago.I had a bit different regime.I had first chemo 7 cycles so more then you.Then I had lumpectomy and 20 rounds of radio. Chemo left me bit mentally drained but I must say it worked and saved my life actually in last minute because it was grade 3 and 1 lymphnode involved.After chemo had no lymphnode involved and the tumor was downgraded to 2. I know its hard but i am glad i did it.I am only 41 and every percent for me that the cancer doesnt come back counts for me. First i went without picc line but after 2nd cycle I had to agree with it because my veins were hurting me.For me even the picc line experience wasnt nice but in the end it was a neccessary thing.Its was annoying bit because i couldnt have a bath properly because i worried to get it wet and i was constantly checking if the tube is not coming out.Just be carefull not to lift anything heavy with that arm where your picc line will be and keep eye on it. Anyway nearly 2 years from treatment i am still here and healthy.No side effects and hair like before chemo. Anyway just look after yourself and please dont google about any statistics.Eat healthy and drink lots of water. Wishing you good luck and sending hugs.
Posts.Title: Breast cancer diagnosis and terrified of chemotherapy and radiotherapy...

Posts.Content: Hello.I was told when i was diagnosed with TNBC grade 3 first that i just will have 6 rounds of chemo and later then changed for 8.I wasnt very amused.In the end I just had 7 because I had a really bad panic attack with the 7th one and just had enough so refused the 8th one.Anyway evem the 7 rounds did the job my lump shrink almost to nothing.And in March had my 1st year mammogram and was all clear.Chemo is not very pleasant but you will go through of it.For me was the mental side i was bad with.The waiting,sometimes i had appointment in the morning but had to wait 2 hours because had no chair or something else.But since its all over I am trying to forget it. I wish you all the best
Posts.Title: 6 or 8 cycles

Posts.Content: Hello.I was using E45 only and did the job.Had no issues at all.Soon as I got home from radiotherapy I applied cream all over my chest and my hubby helped to cream my back in the evening.I was told not to apply anything before the radio session just keep the skin clean and dry.And drink a lot it helps your skin be moisturized. I have order also this R1 gel but I have wasted 60 pound on it because even I bought it on the official website it was never delivered.And honestly I think it's just a business. Aveeno or this E45 costs less money and help protect you too. Anyway if you have any issues the nurse will give you advice. Wishing you good luck
Posts.Title: Can anyone advise which creams are best for moisturising after radiotherapy...

Posts.Content: Hello.First few rounds of chemo I booked appts with the nurse on the chemo unit.so I went to the hospital but I was living 5 min walk from the hospital.The nurse injected for me.I wasn't confident to do it and my husband either.But last 3 rounds of chemo I got tired to go there for the injection we found on the internet how to do it and my husband did it.And was ok.Dont forget to change the injected sites not always the same place. I wish you good luck with your treatment I am 2 years after treatment and doing well. Deniss

Posts.Title: Advert

Posts.Content: Hello,you are not beeing stupid and definitely dont need kick:)) Cancer and the treatment are not fun and employers and the gov should understand it but unfortunately sometimes they dont. I had chemo,lumpectomy and radio which i finished last year.I was signed off sick till i didnt finish chemo and was getting help with the rent.The sick pay was so rubbish.After chemo i have asked to reduce my hrs from fulltime to 15 hrs per week because my work load.I am working as care assistant so physically is very demanding job.I was still working part-time,but I am going back full time from next week because the gov said my husband ment to pay for me everything and they reduced my housing benefits so I said to myself I will rather to work 3x12 hrs shifts in a week then to beg and get nervous about the benefits. I dont know how i will cope but there is no option.Sometimes I wonder if we work where all our taxes go when we need a little help. I hope you will get sorted out everything Denisa
